      • getCertificate

        Returns:

      • getCertificate

        X509Certificate getCertificate(String alias)
        Returns the certificate from the Predix Machine keystore associated with the specified alias
        Parameters:
        alias - The alias of the certificate to return
        Returns:
        the certificate pertaining to the configured certificate

      • getCertificateChain

        X509Certificate[] getCertificateChain()
        Gets a certificate chain from the keystore
        Returns:
        The certificate chain pertaining to the configured alias. The chain includes the requested certificate itself as the first array element followed by each subsequent intermediate CA and then the trusted self signed root CA certificate as the last element. The return value can potentially have zero elements if no certificates exist by the specified alias, one element for a self signed certificate, or more than one for a certificate signed by one to many CA's

      • getCertificateChain

        X509Certificate[] getCertificateChain(String alias)
        Gets a certificate chain from the keystore
        Parameters:
        alias - The alias of the certificate to return
        Returns:
        The certificate chain pertaining to the configured alias. The chain includes the requested certificate itself as the first array element followed by each subsequent intermediate CA and then the trusted self signed root CA certificate as the last element. The return value can potentially have zero elements if no certificates exist by the specified alias, one element for a self signed certificate, or more than one for a certificate signed by one to many CA's

      • encryptConfigProperty

        void encryptConfigProperty(String pid,
                         String property)
        Mangles a property in a bundle's config file. May cause service components Modified method to get called
        Parameters:
        pid - the process ID of the bundle
        property - the property name to encrypt

      • encryptConfigPropertyWithStatus

        boolean encryptConfigPropertyWithStatus(String pid,
                                      String property)
        Mangles a property in a bundle's config file. This performs the same function as encryptConfigProperty(String, String) except it returns a boolean for whether or not anything was modified
        Parameters:
        pid - the process ID of the bundle
        property - the property name to encrypt
        Returns:
        true if a property was written, false if nothing was done
        Since:
        16.2

      • encryptConfigPropertyWithStatus

        boolean encryptConfigPropertyWithStatus(Dictionary<String,Object> props,
                                      String pid,
                                      String property)
        Mangles a property in a the given property object. This does not write the object back to configuration. Use this if you must encrypt or update more than one property.
        Parameters:
        props - the configuration properties object.
        pid - the process ID of the bundle
        property - the property name to encrypt
        Returns:
        true if a property was written, false if nothing was done
        Since:
        16.2

      • getDecryptedConfigProperty

        char[] getDecryptedConfigProperty(String pid,
                                String property)
        Returns the unencrypted property from a bundle's config file
        Parameters:
        pid - the process ID of the bundle
        property - the property value to return
        Returns:
        a char array containing the value of a config property

      • bindConfigurationToBundle

        boolean bindConfigurationToBundle(String configPid,
                                String bundleLocationIdentifier)
        A configuration can be bound to a bundle location ( Bundle.getLocation()). The purpose of binding a Configuration object to a location is to make it impossible for another bundle to forge a PID that would match this configuration. When a configuration is bound to a specific location, and a bundle with a different location registers a corresponding ManagedService object or ManagedServiceFactory object, then the configuration is not passed to the updated method of that object. Note: calling bundle must have permission: (org.osgi.service.cm.ConfigurationPermission "*" "configure")
        Parameters:
        configPid - The component PID (SERVICE_PID) for the configuration.
        bundleLocationIdentifier - bundle location to bind. (i.e. from "ComponentContext.getBundleContext().getBundle().getLocation()")
        Returns:
        true on success, false on failure if the bundle could not be bound.

      • cloneConfigurationsProperties

        Dictionary<String,Object> cloneConfigurationsProperties(Dictionary<String,Object> origProps)
        When calling configuration manager to update a property we should never use the original properties object as this is designated as "read-only" by OSGi. In addition, this may write properties from OSGi into the configuration file that causes modify on the service to be called over and over.
        Parameters:
        origProps - the properties return from ConfigurationAdmin-instance.getConfiguration(pid).getProperties();
        Returns:
        clone of the properties ready to have values set.

      • validatePKIXCertChain

        PKIXCertPathValidatorResult validatePKIXCertChain(Certificate[] chain)
                                                  throws CertPathValidatorException
        Validate a PKIX certificate chain against the Security Admin truststore. If a valid path is found to a trusted root certificate, the certificate chain is valid.
        Parameters:
        chain - the certificate chain to validate
        Returns:
        CertPathValidatorResult if validation is successful
        Throws:
        CertPathValidatorException - if validation fails
        com.ge.dspmicro.security.admin.impl.SecurityUtilsException - if the system truststore has not been correctly configured
